extension_description.message: Password Catcher helps protect against phishing attacks.

extension_detailed_description.message:
If you enter your Gmail or Google for Work password into anywhere other than accounts.google.com, you’ll receive an alert so that you can change your password if needed.

Password Catcher also tries to detect fake Google login pages to alert you before you’ve typed in your password. To do so, Password Catcher checks the HTML of each page that you visit to see if it’s impersonating a Google login page.

FAQ
– Does Password Catcher store my password?
No. Password Catcher doesn’t store your password or keystrokes – instead, it uses a secure thumbnail of your password, which it compares against your recent keystrokes within Chrome to help spot the secure thumbnail on sites that might be malicious.

– Where does Password Catcher send data?
If you are using Password Catcher in a Gmail account, Password Catcher does not send any data from your local computer. If your Google for Work administrator deploys Password Catcher across all managed Chrome browsers in your domain, the administrator will receive alerts when Password Catcher triggers.

– What are Password Catcher’s limits?
Password Catcher does not protect incognito windows, Chrome Apps or Chrome Extensions. Nor does it protect passwords for non-Google services. Password Catcher only operates inside the Chrome web browser when Javascript is enabled.

initialization_message.message: For Password Catcher to take effect, please sign in to your account.

initialization_thank_you_message.message: Thank you. Password Catcher is now in effect.

password_warning_banner_body.message: Your Gmail password was just exposed to a non-Gmail login page. You should immediately reset your password to keep your Gmail account secure. Also, please make sure that your Gmail password is not reused on other services – otherwise, if one of your accounts is compromised, they could all be compromised.

phishing_warning_banner_body.message: This site appears to be using a fake version of the Google login page to steal your password, so it has been blocked. If you understand that this site may harm your computer, you may visit this site but please be careful about the information that you type.
